Expand search to 2017-2019 timeframe for adjacent research 4. Investigate broader gut-skin axis research that may include H. pylori components 5. Review conference abstracts and poster presentations from 2018 dermatology meetings
tester
2025-08-02 17:55:35
Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - The code encountered a 'NameError: name 'headers' is not defined' error on every search attempt. The headers variable was defined in the code but appears to be out of scope when the search functions are called. All 13 database searches (6 ClinicalTrials.gov, 3 NIH Reporter, 4 PubMed) failed immediately due to this variable scoping issue, preventing any actual web scraping from occurring. **PLAN** alignment: 0% - no NIH database searches completed, no clinical trial data retrieved. The code did save a results file, but it contains only empty search results due to the error. Immediate fix needed: Move the headers variable definition inside each search function or pass it as a parameter to resolve the scoping issue, then re-run the direct NIH database searches.
Python Code python
import os import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json from datetime import datetime from time import sleep # Since SerpAPI quota is exhausted, we'll use direct web scraping to search NIH databases # This approach will target the most important NIH sources directly print("=" * 90) print("ALTERNATIVE APPROACH: DIRECT NIH DATABASE SEARCHES") print("H. PYLORI & DERMATOLOGICAL CONDITIONS CLINICAL TRIALS (2018)") print("=" * 90) print("Since SerpAPI quota is exhausted, switching to direct web scraping approach") print("Targeting key NIH databases and clinical trial registries directly\n") # Initialize results storage nih_search_results = {} search_timestamp = datetime.now().isoformat() # Define headers for web requests headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate', 'Connection': 'keep-alive', 'Upgrade-Insecure-Requests': '1' } # Function to search ClinicalTrials.gov directly def search_clinicaltrials_gov(): print("1. SEARCHING CLINICALTRIALS.GOV") print("-" * 50) # ClinicalTrials.gov search URLs for different H. pylori and dermatology combinations search_urls = [ # H. pylori + acne searches 'https://clinicaltrials.gov/search?cond=Helicobacter%20pylori&cond=acne&start=2018-01-01&end=2018-12-31', 'https://clinicaltrials.gov/search?term=H.%20pylori%20acne&start=2018-01-01&end=2018-12-31', # H. pylori + dermatology searches 'https://clinicaltrials.gov/search?cond=Helicobacter%20pylori&cond=dermatology&start=2018-01-01&end=2018-12-31', 'https://clinicaltrials.gov/search?term=Helicobacter%20pylori%20dermatological&start=2018-01-01&end=2018-12-31', # Gut-skin axis searches 'https://clinicaltrials.gov/search?term=gut%20skin%20axis&start=2018-01-01&end=2018-12-31', 'https://clinicaltrials.gov/search?term=gastrointestinal%20dermatology&start=2018-01-01&end=2018-12-31' ] clinicaltrials_results = [] for i, url in enumerate(search_urls, 1): try: print(f" Searching URL {i}: {url[:80]}...") response = requests.get(url, headers=headers, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') # Look for study results on the page study_elements = soup.find_all(['div', 'article', 'section'], class_=lambda x: x and ('study' in x.lower() or 'trial' in x.lower() or 'result' in x.lower())) # Also look for any text mentioning studies or trials page_text = soup.get_text().lower() result_info = { 'url': url, 'status_code': response.status_code, 'page_title': soup.title.string if soup.title else 'No title', 'study_elements_found': len(study_elements), 'contains_h_pylori': 'h. pylori' in page_text or 'helicobacter pylori' in page_text, 'contains_acne': 'acne' in page_text, 'contains_dermatology': 'dermatology' in page_text or 'dermatological' in page_text, 'contains_2018': '2018' in page_text, 'page_text_sample': page_text[:500] if page_text else 'No text extracted' } clinicaltrials_results.append(result_info) print(f" ‚úì Status: {response.status_code}, Title: {result_info['page_title'][:60]}...") print(f" ‚úì H.pylori: {result_info['contains_h_pylori']}, Acne: {result_info['contains_acne']}, Dermatology: {result_info['contains_dermatology']}, 2018: {result_info['contains_2018']}") else: print(f" ‚úó Failed with status: {response.status_code}") except Exception as e: print(f" ‚úó Error: {str(e)}") continue sleep(2) # Be respectful to the server return clinicaltrials_results # Function to search NIH Reporter (Project Reporter) def search_nih_reporter(): print("\n2. SEARCHING NIH PROJECT REPORTER") print("-" * 50) # NIH Reporter search URLs reporter_urls = [ 'https://reporter.nih.gov/search?searchId=1&pi_names=&org_names=&org_cities=&org_states_and_countries=&fiscal_years=2018&include_active_projects=true&include_inactive_projects=true&text_search=Helicobacter%20pylori%20acne', 'https://reporter.nih.gov/search?searchId=2&pi_names=&org_names=&org_cities=&org_states_and_countries=&fiscal_years=2018&include_active_projects=true&include_inactive_projects=true&text_search=H.%20pylori%20dermatology', 'https://reporter.nih.gov/search?searchId=3&pi_names=&org_names=&org_cities=&org_states_and_countries=&fiscal_years=2018&include_active_projects=true&include_inactive_projects=true&text_search=gut%20skin%20axis' ] reporter_results = [] for i, url in enumerate(reporter_urls, 1): try: print(f" Searching NIH Reporter URL {i}: {url[:80]}...") response = requests.get(url, headers=headers, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') page_text = soup.get_text().lower() result_info = { 'url': url, 'status_code': response.status_code, 'page_title': soup.title.string if soup.title else 'No title', 'contains_h_pylori': 'h. pylori' in page_text or 'helicobacter pylori' in page_text, 'contains_acne': 'acne' in page_text, 'contains_dermatology': 'dermatology' in page_text or 'dermatological' in page_text, 'contains_2018': '2018' in page_text, 'contains_grant': 'grant' in page_text or 'funding' in page_text, 'page_text_sample': page_text[:500] if page_text else 'No text extracted' } reporter_results.append(result_info) print(f" ‚úì Status: {response.status_code}, Title: {result_info['page_title'][:60]}...") print(f" ‚úì H.pylori: {result_info['contains_h_pylori']}, Acne: {result_info['contains_acne']}, Grant: {result_info['contains_grant']}") else: print(f" ‚úó Failed with status: {response.status_code}") except Exception as e: print(f" ‚úó Error: {str(e)}") continue sleep(2) return reporter_results # Function to search PubMed for NIH-funded studies def search_pubmed_nih(): print("\n3. SEARCHING PUBMED FOR NIH-FUNDED STUDIES") print("-" * 50) # PubMed search URLs for NIH-funded studies pubmed_urls = [ 'https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/?term=Helicobacter+pylori+acne+2018+NIH', 'https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/?term=H.+pylori+dermatology+2018+%22National+Institutes+of+Health%22', 'https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/?term=gut+skin+axis+2018+clinical+trial', 'https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/?term=Helicobacter+pylori+dermatological+2018+pilot+study' ] pubmed_results = [] for i, url in enumerate(pubmed_urls, 1): try: print(f" Searching PubMed URL {i}: {url[:80]}...") response = requests.get(url, headers=headers, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') page_text = soup.get_text().lower() # Look for article titles and abstracts article_elements = soup.find_all(['article', 'div'], class_=lambda x: x and ('article' in x.lower() or 'result' in x.lower() or 'citation' in x.lower())) result_info = { 'url': url, 'status_code': response.status_code, 'page_title': soup.title.string if soup.title else 'No title', 'article_elements_found': len(article_elements), 'contains_h_pylori': 'h. pylori' in page_text or 'helicobacter pylori' in page_text, 'contains_acne': 'acne' in page_text, 'contains_dermatology': 'dermatology' in page_text or 'dermatological' in page_text, 'contains_2018': '2018' in page_text, 'contains_nih': 'nih' in page_text or 'national institutes of health' in page_text, 'contains_clinical_trial': 'clinical trial' in page_text or 'randomized' in page_text, 'page_text_sample': page_text[:500] if page_text else 'No text extracted' } pubmed_results.append(result_info) print(f" ‚úì Status: {response.status_code}, Articles found: {result_info['article_elements_found']}") print(f" ‚úì H.pylori: {result_info['contains_h_pylori']}, NIH: {result_info['contains_nih']}, Trial: {result_info['contains_clinical_trial']}") else: print(f" ‚úó Failed with status: {response.status_code}") except Exception as e: print(f" ‚úó Error: {str(e)}") continue sleep(2) return pubmed_results # Execute all searches print("Executing direct NIH database searches...\n") # Search ClinicalTrials.gov clinicaltrials_data = search_clinicaltrials_gov() nih_search_results['clinicaltrials_gov'] = clinicaltrials_data # Search NIH Reporter reporter_data = search_nih_reporter() nih_search_results['nih_reporter'] = reporter_data # Search PubMed pubmed_data = search_pubmed_nih() nih_search_results['pubmed'] = pubmed_data # Save comprehensive results timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") results_file = f"workspace/direct_nih_search_h_pylori_dermatology_2018_{timestamp}.json" comprehensive_results = { 'search_method': 'Direct NIH Database Web Scraping', 'search_objective': 'Find NIH-funded clinical trials studying H. pylori and dermatological conditions in 2018', 'search_timestamp': search_timestamp, 'databases_searched': ['ClinicalTrials.gov', 'NIH Project Reporter', 'PubMed'], 'search_results': nih_search_results } with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(comprehensive_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print("\n" + "=" * 90) print("DIRECT NIH DATABASE SEARCH ANALYSIS SUMMARY") print("=" * 90) # Analyze collected results total_searches = len(clinicaltrials_data) + len(reporter_data) + len(pubmed_data) successful_searches = sum(1 for result in clinicaltrials_data + reporter_data + pubmed_data if result.get('status_code') == 200) # Find most promising results promising_results = [] for database, results in nih_search_results.items(): for result in results: if result.get('status_code') == 200: relevance_score = 0 if result.get('contains_h_pylori'): relevance_score += 2 if result.get('contains_acne'): relevance_score += 2 if result.get('contains_dermatology'): relevance_score += 2 if result.get('contains_2018'): relevance_score += 1 if result.get('contains_nih'): relevance_score += 1 if result.get('contains_clinical_trial'): relevance_score += 2 if result.get('contains_grant'): relevance_score += 1 if relevance_score >= 4: # High relevance threshold promising_results.append({ 'database': database, 'url': result.get('url'), 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'key_indicators': { 'h_pylori': result.get('contains_h_pylori', False), 'acne': result.get('contains_acne', False), 'dermatology': result.get('contains_dermatology', False), '2018': result.get('contains_2018', False), 'nih': result.get('contains_nih', False), 'clinical_trial': result.get('contains_clinical_trial', False) }, 'page_title': result.get('page_title', 'No title'), 'text_sample': result.get('page_text_sample', '')[:200] }) print(f"üìä SEARCH STATISTICS:") print(f"Total database searches attempted: {total_searches}") print(f"Successful searches (HTTP 200): {successful_searches}") print(f"ClinicalTrials.gov searches: {len(clinicaltrials_data)}") print(f"NIH Reporter searches: {len(reporter_data)}") print(f"PubMed searches: {len(pubmed_data)}") print(f"High-relevance results identified: {len(promising_results)}") if promising_results: print(f"\nüéØ MOST PROMISING RESULTS:") print("-" * 60) for i, result in enumerate(sorted(promising_results, key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True), 1): print(f"\n{i}. Database: {result['database'].upper()} (Relevance Score: {result['relevance_score']})") print(f" Title: {result['page_title'][:80]}...") print(f" URL: {result['url']}") print(f" Key Indicators: {', '.join([k for k, v in result['key_indicators'].items() if v])}") print(f" Text Sample: {result['text_sample']}...") else: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è NO HIGH-RELEVANCE RESULTS FOUND") print("This may indicate:") print("- Limited NIH-funded studies specifically linking H. pylori to dermatological conditions in 2018") print("- Studies may exist but are not easily discoverable through automated searches") print("- Research may have been conducted under different terminology or broader categories") print(f"\nüìÅ DETAILED RESULTS SAVED TO:") print(f"File: {results_file}") print(f"Contains: Complete search results from all NIH databases") print(f"\nüìã RESEARCH FINDINGS SUMMARY:") if promising_results: print("‚úÖ POTENTIAL LEADS IDENTIFIED: Found relevant content in NIH databases") print(" - Multiple database sources accessed successfully") print(" - High-relevance results require detailed manual review") print(" - May contain pilot studies or observational research") else: print("‚ùå LIMITED DIRECT EVIDENCE: No high-relevance automated matches") print(" - May indicate this specific research area was underexplored in 2018") print(" - Could suggest need for manual review of broader gastrointestinal-dermatology research") print(" - Alternative search strategies or time periods may be needed") print(f"\nRECOMMENDED NEXT STEPS:") print(f"1. Manual review of promising results for detailed trial information") print(f"2. Contact NIH program officers in dermatology and gastroenterology divisions") print(f"3. Expand search to 2017-2019 timeframe for adjacent research") print(f"4. Investigate broader gut-skin axis research that may include H. pylori components") print(f"5. Review conference abstracts and poster presentations from 2018 dermatology meetings")
Execution Output
Code Output: ========================================================================================== ALTERNATIVE APPROACH: DIRECT NIH DATABASE SEARCHES H. PYLORI & DERMATOLOGICAL CONDITIONS CLINICAL TRIALS (2018) ========================================================================================== Since SerpAPI quota is exhausted, switching to direct web scraping approach Targeting key NIH databases and clinical trial registries directly Executing direct NIH database searches... 1. Expand search to 2017-2019 timeframe for adjacent research 4. Investigate broader gut-skin axis research that may include H. pylori components 5. developer
2025-08-02 17:57:11
Code Execution - Plan #2 (Iteration 3)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json from datetime import datetime from time import sleep # Fix the headers scoping issue by defining headers within each function # This will resolve the NameError that prevented the previous searches print("=" * 90) print("FIXED APPROACH: DIRECT NIH DATABASE SEARCHES") print("H. PYLORI & DERMATOLOGICAL CONDITIONS CLINICAL TRIALS (2018)") print("=" * 90) print("Fixed headers scoping issue - now executing direct web scraping approach") print("Targeting key NIH databases and clinical trial registries directly\n") # Initialize results storage nih_search_results = {} search_timestamp = datetime.now().isoformat() # Function to search ClinicalTrials.gov directly def search_clinicaltrials_gov(): print("1. SEARCHING CLINICALTRIALS.GOV") print("-" * 50) # Define headers within function to fix scoping issue headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate', 'Connection': 'keep-alive', 'Upgrade-Insecure-Requests': '1' } # ClinicalTrials.gov search URLs for different H. pylori and dermatology combinations search_urls = [ # H. pylori + acne searches 'https://clinicaltrials.gov/search?cond=Helicobacter%20pylori&cond=acne&start=2018-01-01&end=2018-12-31', 'https://clinicaltrials.gov/search?term=H.%20pylori%20acne&start=2018-01-01&end=2018-12-31', # H. pylori + dermatology searches 'https://clinicaltrials.gov/search?cond=Helicobacter%20pylori&cond=dermatology&start=2018-01-01&end=2018-12-31', 'https://clinicaltrials.gov/search?term=Helicobacter%20pylori%20dermatological&start=2018-01-01&end=2018-12-31', # Gut-skin axis searches 'https://clinicaltrials.gov/search?term=gut%20skin%20axis&start=2018-01-01&end=2018-12-31', 'https://clinicaltrials.gov/search?term=gastrointestinal%20dermatology&start=2018-01-01&end=2018-12-31' ] clinicaltrials_results = [] for i, url in enumerate(search_urls, 1): try: print(f" Searching URL {i}: {url[:80]}...") response = requests.get(url, headers=headers, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') # Look for study results on the page study_elements = soup.find_all(['div', 'article', 'section'], class_=lambda x: x and ('study' in x.lower() or 'trial' in x.lower() or 'result' in x.lower())) # Also look for any text mentioning studies or trials page_text = soup.get_text().lower() result_info = { 'url': url, 'status_code': response.status_code, 'page_title': soup.title.string if soup.title else 'No title', 'study_elements_found': len(study_elements), 'contains_h_pylori': 'h. pylori' in page_text or 'helicobacter pylori' in page_text, 'contains_acne': 'acne' in page_text, 'contains_dermatology': 'dermatology' in page_text or 'dermatological' in page_text, 'contains_2018': '2018' in page_text, 'page_text_sample': page_text[:500] if page_text else 'No text extracted' } clinicaltrials_results.append(result_info) print(f" ‚úì Status: {response.status_code}, Title: {result_info['page_title'][:60]}...") print(f" ‚úì H.pylori: {result_info['contains_h_pylori']}, Acne: {result_info['contains_acne']}, Dermatology: {result_info['contains_dermatology']}, 2018: {result_info['contains_2018']}") else: print(f" ‚úó Failed with status: {response.status_code}") clinicaltrials_results.append({ 'url': url, 'status_code': response.status_code, 'error': f'HTTP {response.status_code}' }) except Exception as e: print(f" ‚úó Error: {str(e)}") clinicaltrials_results.append({ 'url': url, 'error': str(e) }) continue sleep(2) # Be respectful to the server return clinicaltrials_results # Function to search NIH Reporter (Project Reporter) def search_nih_reporter(): print("\n2. SEARCHING NIH PROJECT REPORTER") print("-" * 50) # Define headers within function headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate', 'Connection': 'keep-alive', 'Upgrade-Insecure-Requests': '1' } # NIH Reporter search URLs reporter_urls = [ 'https://reporter.nih.gov/search?searchId=1&pi_names=&org_names=&org_cities=&org_states_and_countries=&fiscal_years=2018&include_active_projects=true&include_inactive_projects=true&text_search=Helicobacter%20pylori%20acne', 'https://reporter.nih.gov/search?searchId=2&pi_names=&org_names=&org_cities=&org_states_and_countries=&fiscal_years=2018&include_active_projects=true&include_inactive_projects=true&text_search=H.%20pylori%20dermatology', 'https://reporter.nih.gov/search?searchId=3&pi_names=&org_names=&org_cities=&org_states_and_countries=&fiscal_years=2018&include_active_projects=true&include_inactive_projects=true&text_search=gut%20skin%20axis' ] reporter_results = [] for i, url in enumerate(reporter_urls, 1): try: print(f" Searching NIH Reporter URL {i}: {url[:80]}...") response = requests.get(url, headers=headers, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') page_text = soup.get_text().lower() result_info = { 'url': url, 'status_code': response.status_code, 'page_title': soup.title.string if soup.title else 'No title', 'contains_h_pylori': 'h. pylori' in page_text or 'helicobacter pylori' in page_text, 'contains_acne': 'acne' in page_text, 'contains_dermatology': 'dermatology' in page_text or 'dermatological' in page_text, 'contains_2018': '2018' in page_text, 'contains_grant': 'grant' in page_text or 'funding' in page_text, 'page_text_sample': page_text[:500] if page_text else 'No text extracted' } reporter_results.append(result_info) print(f" ‚úì Status: {response.status_code}, Title: {result_info['page_title'][:60]}...") print(f" ‚úì H.pylori: {result_info['contains_h_pylori']}, Acne: {result_info['contains_acne']}, Grant: {result_info['contains_grant']}") else: print(f" ‚úó Failed with status: {response.status_code}") reporter_results.append({ 'url': url, 'status_code': response.status_code, 'error': f'HTTP {response.status_code}' }) except Exception as e: print(f" ‚úó Error: {str(e)}") reporter_results.append({ 'url': url, 'error': str(e) }) continue sleep(2) return reporter_results # Function to search PubMed for NIH-funded studies def search_pubmed_nih(): print("\n3. SEARCHING PUBMED FOR NIH-FUNDED STUDIES") print("-" * 50) # Define headers within function headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate', 'Connection': 'keep-alive', 'Upgrade-Insecure-Requests': '1' } # PubMed search URLs for NIH-funded studies pubmed_urls = [ 'https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/?term=Helicobacter+pylori+acne+2018+NIH', 'https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/?term=H.+pylori+dermatology+2018+%22National+Institutes+of+Health%22', 'https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/?term=gut+skin+axis+2018+clinical+trial', 'https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/?term=Helicobacter+pylori+dermatological+2018+pilot+study' ] pubmed_results = [] for i, url in enumerate(pubmed_urls, 1): try: print(f" Searching PubMed URL {i}: {url[:80]}...") response = requests.get(url, headers=headers, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') page_text = soup.get_text().lower() # Look for article titles and abstracts article_elements = soup.find_all(['article', 'div'], class_=lambda x: x and ('article' in x.lower() or 'result' in x.lower() or 'citation' in x.lower())) result_info = { 'url': url, 'status_code': response.status_code, 'page_title': soup.title.string if soup.title else 'No title', 'article_elements_found': len(article_elements), 'contains_h_pylori': 'h. pylori' in page_text or 'helicobacter pylori' in page_text, 'contains_acne': 'acne' in page_text, 'contains_dermatology': 'dermatology' in page_text or 'dermatological' in page_text, 'contains_2018': '2018' in page_text, 'contains_nih': 'nih' in page_text or 'national institutes of health' in page_text, 'contains_clinical_trial': 'clinical trial' in page_text or 'randomized' in page_text, 'page_text_sample': page_text[:500] if page_text else 'No text extracted' } pubmed_results.append(result_info) print(f" ‚úì Status: {response.status_code}, Articles found: {result_info['article_elements_found']}") print(f" ‚úì H.pylori: {result_info['contains_h_pylori']}, NIH: {result_info['contains_nih']}, Trial: {result_info['contains_clinical_trial']}") else: print(f" ‚úó Failed with status: {response.status_code}") pubmed_results.append({ 'url': url, 'status_code': response.status_code, 'error': f'HTTP {response.status_code}' }) except Exception as e: print(f" ‚úó Error: {str(e)}") pubmed_results.append({ 'url': url, 'error': str(e) }) continue sleep(2) return pubmed_results # Execute all searches print("Executing direct NIH database searches with fixed headers...\n") # Search ClinicalTrials.gov clinicaltrials_data = search_clinicaltrials_gov() nih_search_results['clinicaltrials_gov'] = clinicaltrials_data # Search NIH Reporter reporter_data = search_nih_reporter() nih_search_results['nih_reporter'] = reporter_data # Search PubMed pubmed_data = search_pubmed_nih() nih_search_results['pubmed'] = pubmed_data # Save comprehensive results timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") results_file = f"workspace/fixed_direct_nih_search_h_pylori_dermatology_2018_{timestamp}.json" comprehensive_results = { 'search_method': 'Fixed Direct NIH Database Web Scraping', 'search_objective': 'Find NIH-funded clinical trials studying H. pylori and dermatological conditions in 2018', 'search_timestamp': search_timestamp, 'databases_searched': ['ClinicalTrials.gov', 'NIH Project Reporter', 'PubMed'], 'search_results': nih_search_results } with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(comprehensive_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print("\n" + "=" * 90) print("FIXED DIRECT NIH DATABASE SEARCH ANALYSIS SUMMARY") print("=" * 90) # Analyze collected results total_searches = len(clinicaltrials_data) + len(reporter_data) + len(pubmed_data) successful_searches = sum(1 for result in clinicaltrials_data + reporter_data + pubmed_data if result.get('status_code') == 200) # Find most promising results promising_results = [] for database, results in nih_search_results.items(): for result in results: if result.get('status_code') == 200: relevance_score = 0 if result.get('contains_h_pylori'): relevance_score += 2 if result.get('contains_acne'): relevance_score += 2 if result.get('contains_dermatology'): relevance_score += 2 if result.get('contains_2018'): relevance_score += 1 if result.get('contains_nih'): relevance_score += 1 if result.get('contains_clinical_trial'): relevance_score += 2 if result.get('contains_grant'): relevance_score += 1 if relevance_score >= 3: # Lowered threshold to capture more potential leads promising_results.append({ 'database': database, 'url': result.get('url'), 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'key_indicators': { 'h_pylori': result.get('contains_h_pylori', False), 'acne': result.get('contains_acne', False), 'dermatology': result.get('contains_dermatology', False), '2018': result.get('contains_2018', False), 'nih': result.get('contains_nih', False), 'clinical_trial': result.get('contains_clinical_trial', False) }, 'page_title': result.get('page_title', 'No title'), 'text_sample': result.get('page_text_sample', '')[:200] }) print(f"üìä SEARCH STATISTICS:") print(f"Total database searches attempted: {total_searches}") print(f"Successful searches (HTTP 200): {successful_searches}") print(f"ClinicalTrials.gov searches: {len(clinicaltrials_data)}") print(f"NIH Reporter searches: {len(reporter_data)}") print(f"PubMed searches: {len(pubmed_data)}") print(f"High-relevance results identified: {len(promising_results)}") if promising_results: print(f"\nüéØ MOST PROMISING RESULTS:") print("-" * 60) for i, result in enumerate(sorted(promising_results, key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True), 1): print(f"\n{i}. Database: {result['database'].upper()} (Relevance Score: {result['relevance_score']})") print(f" Title: {result['page_title'][:80]}...") print(f" URL: {result['url']}") print(f" Key Indicators: {', '.join([k for k, v in result['key_indicators'].items() if v])}") print(f" Text Sample: {result['text_sample']}...") else: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è NO HIGH-RELEVANCE RESULTS FOUND") print("This may indicate:") print("- Limited NIH-funded studies specifically linking H. pylori to dermatological conditions in 2018") print("- Studies may exist but are not easily discoverable through automated searches") print("- Research may have been conducted under different terminology or broader categories") # Show detailed breakdown of each database's results print(f"\nüìã DETAILED DATABASE BREAKDOWN:") print("-" * 60) for database, results in nih_search_results.items(): successful_db_searches = sum(1 for result in results if result.get('status_code') == 200) print(f"\n{database.upper()}:") print(f" Total searches: {len(results)}") print(f" Successful: {successful_db_searches}") for i, result in enumerate(results, 1): if result.get('status_code') == 200: print(f" Search {i}: ‚úì {result.get('page_title', 'No title')[:50]}...") if result.get('contains_h_pylori') or result.get('contains_acne') or result.get('contains_dermatology'): print(f" ‚Üí Contains relevant terms: H.pylori={result.get('contains_h_pylori')}, Acne={result.get('contains_acne')}, Dermatology={result.get('contains_dermatology')}") else: print(f" Search {i}: ‚úó Failed - {result.get('error', 'Unknown error')}") print(f"\nüìÅ DETAILED RESULTS SAVED TO:") print(f"File: {results_file}") print(f"Contains: Complete search results from all NIH databases with fixed headers") print(f"\nüìã RESEARCH FINDINGS SUMMARY:") if promising_results: print("‚úÖ POTENTIAL LEADS IDENTIFIED: Found relevant content in NIH databases") print(" - Multiple database sources accessed successfully") print(" - High-relevance results require detailed manual review") print(" - May contain pilot studies or observational research") elif successful_searches > 0: print("üîç PARTIAL SUCCESS: Database searches completed but limited relevant content") print(" - Successfully accessed NIH databases") print(" - Limited specific H. pylori + dermatology + 2018 combinations found") print(" - May indicate this research area was underexplored in 2018") else: print("‚ùå TECHNICAL ISSUES: Unable to successfully access NIH databases") print(" - Network connectivity or server access problems") print(" - Alternative search strategies needed") print(f"\nRECOMMENDED NEXT STEPS:") if promising_results: print(f"1. Manual review of {len(promising_results)} promising results for detailed trial information") print(f"2. Follow up on specific URLs identified in the search results") print(f"3. Contact authors or institutions mentioned in relevant results") else: print(f"1. Expand search terms to include broader gastrointestinal-dermatology research") print(f"2. Search adjacent years (2017-2019) for related studies") print(f"3. Contact NIH program officers directly for unpublished or ongoing studies") print(f"4. Review conference abstracts and poster presentations from dermatology meetings") print(f"5. Investigate investigator-initiated trials that may not be in major registries")

2025-08-02 17:57:11
Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - The code encountered a 'NameError: name 'BeautifulSoup' is not defined' error on every search attempt across all 13 database searches (6 ClinicalTrials.gov, 3 NIH Reporter, 4 PubMed). While the code correctly fixed the headers scoping issue from the previous attempt by defining headers within each function, it failed because BeautifulSoup was imported at the top but the import statement appears to not be working properly. All searches failed immediately when trying to parse HTML content, preventing any actual NIH database scraping from occurring. **PLAN** alignment: 0% - no NIH clinical trial data retrieved, no searches completed successfully. The code did save a results file but it contains only error messages. Immediate fix needed: Verify the BeautifulSoup import statement is correct (should be 'from bs4 import BeautifulSoup') and ensure the bs4 library is available, then re-run the NIH database searches.
Python Code python
import os import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json from datetime import datetime from time import sleep # Fix the headers scoping issue by defining headers within each function # This will resolve the NameError that prevented the previous searches print("=" * 90) print("FIXED APPROACH: DIRECT NIH DATABASE SEARCHES") print("H. PYLORI & DERMATOLOGICAL CONDITIONS CLINICAL TRIALS (2018)") print("=" * 90) print("Fixed headers scoping issue - now executing direct web scraping approach") print("Targeting key NIH databases and clinical trial registries directly\n") # Initialize results storage nih_search_results = {} search_timestamp = datetime.now().isoformat() # Function to search ClinicalTrials.gov directly def search_clinicaltrials_gov(): print("1. SEARCHING CLINICALTRIALS.GOV") print("-" * 50) # Define headers within function to fix scoping issue headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate', 'Connection': 'keep-alive', 'Upgrade-Insecure-Requests': '1' } # ClinicalTrials.gov search URLs for different H. pylori and dermatology combinations search_urls = [ # H. pylori + acne searches 'https://clinicaltrials.gov/search?cond=Helicobacter%20pylori&cond=acne&start=2018-01-01&end=2018-12-31', 'https://clinicaltrials.gov/search?term=H.%20pylori%20acne&start=2018-01-01&end=2018-12-31', # H. pylori + dermatology searches 'https://clinicaltrials.gov/search?cond=Helicobacter%20pylori&cond=dermatology&start=2018-01-01&end=2018-12-31', 'https://clinicaltrials.gov/search?term=Helicobacter%20pylori%20dermatological&start=2018-01-01&end=2018-12-31', # Gut-skin axis searches 'https://clinicaltrials.gov/search?term=gut%20skin%20axis&start=2018-01-01&end=2018-12-31', 'https://clinicaltrials.gov/search?term=gastrointestinal%20dermatology&start=2018-01-01&end=2018-12-31' ] clinicaltrials_results = [] for i, url in enumerate(search_urls, 1): try: print(f" Searching URL {i}: {url[:80]}...") response = requests.get(url, headers=headers, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') # Look for study results on the page study_elements = soup.find_all(['div', 'article', 'section'], class_=lambda x: x and ('study' in x.lower() or 'trial' in x.lower() or 'result' in x.lower())) # Also look for any text mentioning studies or trials page_text = soup.get_text().lower() result_info = { 'url': url, 'status_code': response.status_code, 'page_title': soup.title.string if soup.title else 'No title', 'study_elements_found': len(study_elements), 'contains_h_pylori': 'h. pylori' in page_text or 'helicobacter pylori' in page_text, 'contains_acne': 'acne' in page_text, 'contains_dermatology': 'dermatology' in page_text or 'dermatological' in page_text, 'contains_2018': '2018' in page_text, 'page_text_sample': page_text[:500] if page_text else 'No text extracted' } clinicaltrials_results.append(result_info) print(f" ‚úì Status: {response.status_code}, Title: {result_info['page_title'][:60]}...") print(f" ‚úì H.pylori: {result_info['contains_h_pylori']}, Acne: {result_info['contains_acne']}, Dermatology: {result_info['contains_dermatology']}, 2018: {result_info['contains_2018']}") else: print(f" ‚úó Failed with status: {response.status_code}") clinicaltrials_results.append({ 'url': url, 'status_code': response.status_code, 'error': f'HTTP {response.status_code}' }) except Exception as e: print(f" ‚úó Error: {str(e)}") clinicaltrials_results.append({ 'url': url, 'error': str(e) }) continue sleep(2) # Be respectful to the server return clinicaltrials_results # Function to search NIH Reporter (Project Reporter) def search_nih_reporter(): print("\n2. SEARCHING NIH PROJECT REPORTER") print("-" * 50) # Define headers within function headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate', 'Connection': 'keep-alive', 'Upgrade-Insecure-Requests': '1' } # NIH Reporter search URLs reporter_urls = [ 'https://reporter.nih.gov/search?searchId=1&pi_names=&org_names=&org_cities=&org_states_and_countries=&fiscal_years=2018&include_active_projects=true&include_inactive_projects=true&text_search=Helicobacter%20pylori%20acne', 'https://reporter.nih.gov/search?searchId=2&pi_names=&org_names=&org_cities=&org_states_and_countries=&fiscal_years=2018&include_active_projects=true&include_inactive_projects=true&text_search=H.%20pylori%20dermatology', 'https://reporter.nih.gov/search?searchId=3&pi_names=&org_names=&org_cities=&org_states_and_countries=&fiscal_years=2018&include_active_projects=true&include_inactive_projects=true&text_search=gut%20skin%20axis' ] reporter_results = [] for i, url in enumerate(reporter_urls, 1): try: print(f" Searching NIH Reporter URL {i}: {url[:80]}...") response = requests.get(url, headers=headers, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') page_text = soup.get_text().lower() result_info = { 'url': url, 'status_code': response.status_code, 'page_title': soup.title.string if soup.title else 'No title', 'contains_h_pylori': 'h. pylori' in page_text or 'helicobacter pylori' in page_text, 'contains_acne': 'acne' in page_text, 'contains_dermatology': 'dermatology' in page_text or 'dermatological' in page_text, 'contains_2018': '2018' in page_text, 'contains_grant': 'grant' in page_text or 'funding' in page_text, 'page_text_sample': page_text[:500] if page_text else 'No text extracted' } reporter_results.append(result_info) print(f" ‚úì Status: {response.status_code}, Title: {result_info['page_title'][:60]}...") print(f" ‚úì H.pylori: {result_info['contains_h_pylori']}, Acne: {result_info['contains_acne']}, Grant: {result_info['contains_grant']}") else: print(f" ‚úó Failed with status: {response.status_code}") reporter_results.append({ 'url': url, 'status_code': response.status_code, 'error': f'HTTP {response.status_code}' }) except Exception as e: print(f" ‚úó Error: {str(e)}") reporter_results.append({ 'url': url, 'error': str(e) }) continue sleep(2) return reporter_results # Function to search PubMed for NIH-funded studies def search_pubmed_nih(): print("\n3. SEARCHING PUBMED FOR NIH-FUNDED STUDIES") print("-" * 50) # Define headers within function headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate', 'Connection': 'keep-alive', 'Upgrade-Insecure-Requests': '1' } # PubMed search URLs for NIH-funded studies pubmed_urls = [ 'https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/?term=Helicobacter+pylori+acne+2018+NIH', 'https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/?term=H.+pylori+dermatology+2018+%22National+Institutes+of+Health%22', 'https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/?term=gut+skin+axis+2018+clinical+trial', 'https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/?term=Helicobacter+pylori+dermatological+2018+pilot+study' ] pubmed_results = [] for i, url in enumerate(pubmed_urls, 1): try: print(f" Searching PubMed URL {i}: {url[:80]}...") response = requests.get(url, headers=headers, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') page_text = soup.get_text().lower() # Look for article titles and abstracts article_elements = soup.find_all(['article', 'div'], class_=lambda x: x and ('article' in x.lower() or 'result' in x.lower() or 'citation' in x.lower())) result_info = { 'url': url, 'status_code': response.status_code, 'page_title': soup.title.string if soup.title else 'No title', 'article_elements_found': len(article_elements), 'contains_h_pylori': 'h. pylori' in page_text or 'helicobacter pylori' in page_text, 'contains_acne': 'acne' in page_text, 'contains_dermatology': 'dermatology' in page_text or 'dermatological' in page_text, 'contains_2018': '2018' in page_text, 'contains_nih': 'nih' in page_text or 'national institutes of health' in page_text, 'contains_clinical_trial': 'clinical trial' in page_text or 'randomized' in page_text, 'page_text_sample': page_text[:500] if page_text else 'No text extracted' } pubmed_results.append(result_info) print(f" ‚úì Status: {response.status_code}, Articles found: {result_info['article_elements_found']}") print(f" ‚úì H.pylori: {result_info['contains_h_pylori']}, NIH: {result_info['contains_nih']}, Trial: {result_info['contains_clinical_trial']}") else: print(f" ‚úó Failed with status: {response.status_code}") pubmed_results.append({ 'url': url, 'status_code': response.status_code, 'error': f'HTTP {response.status_code}' }) except Exception as e: print(f" ‚úó Error: {str(e)}") pubmed_results.append({ 'url': url, 'error': str(e) }) continue sleep(2) return pubmed_results # Execute all searches print("Executing direct NIH database searches with fixed headers...\n") # Search ClinicalTrials.gov clinicaltrials_data = search_clinicaltrials_gov() nih_search_results['clinicaltrials_gov'] = clinicaltrials_data # Search NIH Reporter reporter_data = search_nih_reporter() nih_search_results['nih_reporter'] = reporter_data # Search PubMed pubmed_data = search_pubmed_nih() nih_search_results['pubmed'] = pubmed_data # Save comprehensive results timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") results_file = f"workspace/fixed_direct_nih_search_h_pylori_dermatology_2018_{timestamp}.json" comprehensive_results = { 'search_method': 'Fixed Direct NIH Database Web Scraping', 'search_objective': 'Find NIH-funded clinical trials studying H. pylori and dermatological conditions in 2018', 'search_timestamp': search_timestamp, 'databases_searched': ['ClinicalTrials.gov', 'NIH Project Reporter', 'PubMed'], 'search_results': nih_search_results } with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(comprehensive_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print("\n" + "=" * 90) print("FIXED DIRECT NIH DATABASE SEARCH ANALYSIS SUMMARY") print("=" * 90) # Analyze collected results total_searches = len(clinicaltrials_data) + len(reporter_data) + len(pubmed_data) successful_searches = sum(1 for result in clinicaltrials_data + reporter_data + pubmed_data if result.get('status_code') == 200) # Find most promising results promising_results = [] for database, results in nih_search_results.items(): for result in results: if result.get('status_code') == 200: relevance_score = 0 if result.get('contains_h_pylori'): relevance_score += 2 if result.get('contains_acne'): relevance_score += 2 if result.get('contains_dermatology'): relevance_score += 2 if result.get('contains_2018'): relevance_score += 1 if result.get('contains_nih'): relevance_score += 1 if result.get('contains_clinical_trial'): relevance_score += 2 if result.get('contains_grant'): relevance_score += 1 if relevance_score >= 3: # Lowered threshold to capture more potential leads promising_results.append({ 'database': database, 'url': result.get('url'), 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'key_indicators': { 'h_pylori': result.get('contains_h_pylori', False), 'acne': result.get('contains_acne', False), 'dermatology': result.get('contains_dermatology', False), '2018': result.get('contains_2018', False), 'nih': result.get('contains_nih', False), 'clinical_trial': result.get('contains_clinical_trial', False) }, 'page_title': result.get('page_title', 'No title'), 'text_sample': result.get('page_text_sample', '')[:200] }) print(f"üìä SEARCH STATISTICS:") print(f"Total database searches attempted: {total_searches}") print(f"Successful searches (HTTP 200): {successful_searches}") print(f"ClinicalTrials.gov searches: {len(clinicaltrials_data)}") print(f"NIH Reporter searches: {len(reporter_data)}") print(f"PubMed searches: {len(pubmed_data)}") print(f"High-relevance results identified: {len(promising_results)}") if promising_results: print(f"\nüéØ MOST PROMISING RESULTS:") print("-" * 60) for i, result in enumerate(sorted(promising_results, key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True), 1): print(f"\n{i}. Database: {result['database'].upper()} (Relevance Score: {result['relevance_score']})") print(f" Title: {result['page_title'][:80]}...") print(f" URL: {result['url']}") print(f" Key Indicators: {', '.join([k for k, v in result['key_indicators'].items() if v])}") print(f" Text Sample: {result['text_sample']}...") else: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è NO HIGH-RELEVANCE RESULTS FOUND") print("This may indicate:") print("- Limited NIH-funded studies specifically linking H. pylori to dermatological conditions in 2018") print("- Studies may exist but are not easily discoverable through automated searches") print("- Research may have been conducted under different terminology or broader categories") # Show detailed breakdown of each database's results print(f"\nüìã DETAILED DATABASE BREAKDOWN:") print("-" * 60) for database, results in nih_search_results.items(): successful_db_searches = sum(1 for result in results if result.get('status_code') == 200) print(f"\n{database.upper()}:") print(f" Total searches: {len(results)}") print(f" Successful: {successful_db_searches}") for i, result in enumerate(results, 1): if result.get('status_code') == 200: print(f" Search {i}: ‚úì {result.get('page_title', 'No title')[:50]}...") if result.get('contains_h_pylori') or result.get('contains_acne') or result.get('contains_dermatology'): print(f" ‚Üí Contains relevant terms: H.pylori={result.get('contains_h_pylori')}, Acne={result.get('contains_acne')}, Dermatology={result.get('contains_dermatology')}") else: print(f" Search {i}: ‚úó Failed - {result.get('error', 'Unknown error')}") print(f"\nüìÅ DETAILED RESULTS SAVED TO:") print(f"File: {results_file}") print(f"Contains: Complete search results from all NIH databases with fixed headers") print(f"\nüìã RESEARCH FINDINGS SUMMARY:") if promising_results: print("‚úÖ POTENTIAL LEADS IDENTIFIED: Found relevant content in NIH databases") print(" - Multiple database sources accessed successfully") print(" - High-relevance results require detailed manual review") print(" - May contain pilot studies or observational research") elif successful_searches > 0: print("üîç PARTIAL SUCCESS: Database searches completed but limited relevant content") print(" - Successfully accessed NIH databases") print(" - Limited specific H. pylori + dermatology + 2018 combinations found") print(" - May indicate this research area was underexplored in 2018") else: print("‚ùå TECHNICAL ISSUES: Unable to successfully access NIH databases") print(" - Network connectivity or server access problems") print(" - Alternative search strategies needed") print(f"\nRECOMMENDED NEXT STEPS:") if promising_results: print(f"1. Manual review of {len(promising_results)} promising results for detailed trial information") print(f"2. Follow up on specific URLs identified in the search results") print(f"3. Contact authors or institutions mentioned in relevant results") else: print(f"1. Expand search terms to include broader gastrointestinal-dermatology research") print(f"2. Search adjacent years (2017-2019) for related studies") print(f"3. Contact NIH program officers directly for unpublished or ongoing studies") print(f"4. Review conference abstracts and poster presentations from dermatology meetings") print(f"5. Investigate investigator-initiated trials that may not be in major registries")
Execution Output

Code Execution - Plan #2 (Iteration 4)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import requests import json from datetime import datetime from time import sleep # Since both SerpAPI and BeautifulSoup approaches failed, let's use a simpler approach # Focus on basic HTTP requests and text analysis without complex HTML parsing print("=" * 90) print("SIMPLIFIED APPROACH: BASIC NIH DATABASE TEXT SEARCHES") print("H. PYLORI & DERMATOLOGICAL CONDITIONS CLINICAL TRIALS (2018)") print("=" * 90) print("Using basic HTTP requests without BeautifulSoup dependency") print("Focusing on text-based analysis of NIH database responses\n") # Initialize results storage nih_search_results = {} search_timestamp = datetime.now().isoformat() # Function to search ClinicalTrials.gov with basic text analysis def search_clinicaltrials_basic(): print("1. SEARCHING CLINICALTRIALS.GOV (BASIC TEXT ANALYSIS)") print("-" * 50) # Define headers within function headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Connection': 'keep-alive' } # Simplified ClinicalTrials.gov search URLs search_urls = [ 'https://clinicaltrials.gov/search?term=Helicobacter+pylori+acne+2018', 'https://clinicaltrials.gov/search?term=H.+pylori+dermatology+2018', 'https://clinicaltrials.gov/search?term=gut+skin+axis+2018', 'https://clinicaltrials.gov/search?term=gastrointestinal+dermatology+2018' ] clinicaltrials_results = [] for i, url in enumerate(search_urls, 1): try: print(f" Searching URL {i}: {url}") response = requests.get(url, headers=headers, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: # Simple text analysis without BeautifulSoup page_text = response.text.lower() # Extract basic information result_info = { 'url': url, 'status_code': response.status_code, 'response_length': len(response.text), 'contains_h_pylori': 'h. pylori' in page_text or 'helicobacter pylori' in page_text, 'contains_acne': 'acne' in page_text, 'contains_dermatology': 'dermatology' in page_text or 'dermatological' in page_text, 'contains_2018': '2018' in page_text, 'contains_clinical_trial': 'clinical trial' in page_text or 'study' in page_text, 'contains_nih': 'nih' in page_text or 'national institutes of health' in page_text, 'page_text_sample': page_text[:1000] if page_text else 'No text extracted' } clinicaltrials_results.append(result_info) print(f" ‚úì Status: {response.status_code}, Response length: {len(response.text)} chars") print(f" ‚úì H.pylori: {result_info['contains_h_pylori']}, Acne: {result_info['contains_acne']}, Dermatology: {result_info['contains_dermatology']}") print(f" ‚úì 2018: {result_info['contains_2018']}, NIH: {result_info['contains_nih']}, Trial: {result_info['contains_clinical_trial']}") # Look for specific patterns in the text if 'no studies found' in page_text or 'no results' in page_text: print(f" ‚Üí No studies found message detected") elif 'study' in page_text and ('2018' in page_text): print(f" ‚Üí Potential 2018 studies detected") else: print(f" ‚úó Failed with status: {response.status_code}") clinicaltrials_results.append({ 'url': url, 'status_code': response.status_code, 'error': f'HTTP {response.status_code}' }) except Exception as e: print(f" ‚úó Error: {str(e)}") clinicaltrials_results.append({ 'url': url, 'error': str(e) }) continue sleep(3) # Be respectful to the server return clinicaltrials_results # Function to search PubMed with basic text analysis def search_pubmed_basic(): print("\n2. SEARCHING PUBMED (BASIC TEXT ANALYSIS)") print("-" * 50) # Define headers within function headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Connection': 'keep-alive' } # PubMed search URLs for NIH-funded studies pubmed_urls = [ 'https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/?term=Helicobacter+pylori+acne+2018+NIH', 'https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/?term=H.+pylori+dermatology+2018+clinical+trial', 'https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/?term=gut+skin+axis+2018+pilot+study', 'https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/?term=Helicobacter+pylori+dermatological+2018' ] pubmed_results = [] for i, url in enumerate(pubmed_urls, 1): try: print(f" Searching PubMed URL {i}: {url}") response = requests.get(url, headers=headers, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: page_text = response.text.lower() result_info = { 'url': url, 'status_code': response.status_code, 'response_length': len(response.text), 'contains_h_pylori': 'h. pylori' in page_text or 'helicobacter pylori' in page_text, 'contains_acne': 'acne' in page_text, 'contains_dermatology': 'dermatology' in page_text or 'dermatological' in page_text, 'contains_2018': '2018' in page_text, 'contains_nih': 'nih' in page_text or 'national institutes of health' in page_text, 'contains_clinical_trial': 'clinical trial' in page_text or 'randomized' in page_text or 'pilot study' in page_text, 'contains_pubmed_results': 'results' in page_text and 'pubmed' in page_text, 'page_text_sample': page_text[:1000] if page_text else 'No text extracted' } pubmed_results.append(result_info) print(f" ‚úì Status: {response.status_code}, Response length: {len(response.text)} chars") print(f" ‚úì H.pylori: {result_info['contains_h_pylori']}, NIH: {result_info['contains_nih']}, Trial: {result_info['contains_clinical_trial']}") print(f" ‚úì PubMed Results: {result_info['contains_pubmed_results']}") # Look for specific patterns if 'no results' in page_text or '0 results' in page_text: print(f" ‚Üí No results found message detected") elif 'result' in page_text and ('2018' in page_text): print(f" ‚Üí Potential 2018 publications detected") else: print(f" ‚úó Failed with status: {response.status_code}") pubmed_results.append({ 'url': url, 'status_code': response.status_code, 'error': f'HTTP {response.status_code}' }) except Exception as e: print(f" ‚úó Error: {str(e)}") pubmed_results.append({ 'url': url, 'error': str(e) }) continue sleep(3) return pubmed_results # Function to search NIH Reporter with basic approach def search_nih_reporter_basic(): print("\n3. SEARCHING NIH REPORTER (BASIC TEXT ANALYSIS)") print("-" * 50) # Define headers within function headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Connection': 'keep-alive' } # Simplified NIH Reporter URLs reporter_urls = [ 'https://reporter.nih.gov/search/results?searchId=1&fiscal_years=2018&text_search=Helicobacter%20pylori%20acne', 'https://reporter.nih.gov/search/results?searchId=2&fiscal_years=2018&text_search=gut%20skin%20axis' ] reporter_results = [] for i, url in enumerate(reporter_urls, 1): try: print(f" Searching NIH Reporter URL {i}: {url}") response = requests.get(url, headers=headers, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: page_text = response.text.lower() result_info = { 'url': url, 'status_code': response.status_code, 'response_length': len(response.text), 'contains_h_pylori': 'h. pylori' in page_text or 'helicobacter pylori' in page_text, 'contains_acne': 'acne' in page_text, 'contains_dermatology': 'dermatology' in page_text or 'dermatological' in page_text, 'contains_2018': '2018' in page_text, 'contains_grant': 'grant' in page_text or 'funding' in page_text, 'contains_project': 'project' in page_text, 'page_text_sample': page_text[:1000] if page_text else 'No text extracted' } reporter_results.append(result_info) print(f" ‚úì Status: {response.status_code}, Response length: {len(response.text)} chars") print(f" ‚úì H.pylori: {result_info['contains_h_pylori']}, Grant: {result_info['contains_grant']}, Project: {result_info['contains_project']}") else: print(f" ‚úó Failed with status: {response.status_code}") reporter_results.append({ 'url': url, 'status_code': response.status_code, 'error': f'HTTP {response.status_code}' }) except Exception as e: print(f" ‚úó Error: {str(e)}") reporter_results.append({ 'url': url, 'error': str(e) }) continue sleep(3) return reporter_results # Execute all searches print("Executing simplified NIH database searches...\n") # Search ClinicalTrials.gov clinicaltrials_data = search_clinicaltrials_basic() nih_search_results['clinicaltrials_gov'] = clinicaltrials_data # Search PubMed pubmed_data = search_pubmed_basic() nih_search_results['pubmed'] = pubmed_data # Search NIH Reporter reporter_data = search_nih_reporter_basic() nih_search_results['nih_reporter'] = reporter_data # Save comprehensive results timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") results_file = f"workspace/simplified_nih_search_h_pylori_dermatology_2018_{timestamp}.json" comprehensive_results = { 'search_method': 'Simplified NIH Database Text Analysis', 'search_objective': 'Find NIH-funded clinical trials studying H. pylori and dermatological conditions in 2018', 'search_timestamp': search_timestamp, 'databases_searched': ['ClinicalTrials.gov', 'PubMed', 'NIH Project Reporter'], 'search_results': nih_search_results } with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(comprehensive_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print("\n" + "=" * 90) print("SIMPLIFIED NIH DATABASE SEARCH ANALYSIS SUMMARY") print("=" * 90) # Analyze collected results total_searches = len(clinicaltrials_data) + len(pubmed_data) + len(reporter_data) successful_searches = sum(1 for result in clinicaltrials_data + pubmed_data + reporter_data if result.get('status_code') == 200) # Find most promising results promising_results = [] for database, results in nih_search_results.items(): for result in results: if result.get('status_code') == 200: relevance_score = 0 if result.get('contains_h_pylori'): relevance_score += 3 if result.get('contains_acne'): relevance_score += 2 if result.get('contains_dermatology'): relevance_score += 2 if result.get('contains_2018'): relevance_score += 2 if result.get('contains_nih'): relevance_score += 1 if result.get('contains_clinical_trial'): relevance_score += 2 if result.get('contains_grant'): relevance_score += 1 if relevance_score >= 4: # Threshold for promising results promising_results.append({ 'database': database, 'url': result.get('url'), 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'key_indicators': { 'h_pylori': result.get('contains_h_pylori', False), 'acne': result.get('contains_acne', False), 'dermatology': result.get('contains_dermatology', False), '2018': result.get('contains_2018', False), 'nih': result.get('contains_nih', False), 'clinical_trial': result.get('contains_clinical_trial', False) }, 'response_length': result.get('response_length', 0), 'text_sample': result.get('page_text_sample', '')[:300] }) print(f"üìä SEARCH STATISTICS:") print(f"Total database searches attempted: {total_searches}") print(f"Successful searches (HTTP 200): {successful_searches}") print(f"ClinicalTrials.gov searches: {len(clinicaltrials_data)}") print(f"PubMed searches: {len(pubmed_data)}") print(f"NIH Reporter searches: {len(reporter_data)}") print(f"High-relevance results identified: {len(promising_results)}") if promising_results: print(f"\nüéØ MOST PROMISING RESULTS:") print("-" * 60) for i, result in enumerate(sorted(promising_results, key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True), 1): print(f"\n{i}. Database: {result['database'].upper()} (Relevance Score: {result['relevance_score']})") print(f" URL: {result['url']}") print(f" Response Length: {result['response_length']} characters") print(f" Key Indicators: {', '.join([k for k, v in result['key_indicators'].items() if v])}") print(f" Text Sample: {result['text_sample']}...") else: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è NO HIGH-RELEVANCE RESULTS FOUND") print("However, let's examine what we did find:") # Show all successful searches even if not high-relevance all_successful = [] for database, results in nih_search_results.items(): for result in results: if result.get('status_code') == 200: all_successful.append({ 'database': database, 'url': result.get('url'), 'contains_any_target': any([ result.get('contains_h_pylori', False), result.get('contains_acne', False), result.get('contains_dermatology', False) ]), 'response_length': result.get('response_length', 0) }) print(f"\nüìã ALL SUCCESSFUL SEARCHES ({len(all_successful)}):") for i, result in enumerate(all_successful, 1): print(f" {i}. {result['database'].upper()}: {result['response_length']} chars, Contains targets: {result['contains_any_target']}") # Show detailed breakdown of each database's results print(f"\nüìã DETAILED DATABASE BREAKDOWN:") print("-" * 60) for database, results in nih_search_results.items(): successful_db_searches = sum(1 for result in results if result.get('status_code') == 200) print(f"\n{database.upper()}:") print(f" Total searches: {len(results)}") print(f" Successful: {successful_db_searches}") for i, result in enumerate(results, 1): if result.get('status_code') == 200: indicators = [] if result.get('contains_h_pylori'): indicators.append('H.pylori') if result.get('contains_acne'): indicators.append('Acne') if result.get('contains_dermatology'): indicators.append('Dermatology') if result.get('contains_2018'): indicators.append('2018') if result.get('contains_nih'): indicators.append('NIH') print(f" Search {i}: ‚úì {result.get('response_length', 0)} chars") if indicators: print(f" ‚Üí Contains: {', '.join(indicators)}") else: print(f" Search {i}: ‚úó Failed - {result.get('error', 'Unknown error')}") print(f"\nüìÅ DETAILED RESULTS SAVED TO:") print(f"File: {results_file}") print(f"Contains: Complete search results from all NIH databases with simplified text analysis") print(f"\nüìã RESEARCH FINDINGS SUMMARY:") if promising_results: print("‚úÖ POTENTIAL LEADS IDENTIFIED: Found relevant content in NIH databases") print(" - High-relevance results require detailed manual review") print(" - May contain references to pilot studies or observational research") print(" - Follow up on specific URLs for detailed trial information") elif successful_searches > 0: print("üîç PARTIAL SUCCESS: Database searches completed but limited specific matches") print(" - Successfully accessed NIH databases") print(" - Limited H. pylori + dermatology + 2018 combinations found") print(" - This may indicate limited research in this specific area during 2018") print(" - Consider broader search terms or adjacent time periods") else: print("‚ùå TECHNICAL ISSUES: Unable to successfully access NIH databases") print(" - Network connectivity or server access problems") print(" - Alternative research strategies needed") print(f"\nüéØ KEY FINDINGS:") if successful_searches > 0: print(f"- Successfully accessed {successful_searches} out of {total_searches} NIH database searches") print(f"- Databases are accessible and responding") print(f"- Text analysis approach working without BeautifulSoup dependency") if not promising_results: print(f"- Limited evidence of specific H. pylori + dermatology clinical trials in 2018") print(f"- May indicate this research area was underexplored during that timeframe") else: print(f"- All database access attempts failed") print(f"- May need alternative approaches or manual research") print(f"\nRECOMMENDED NEXT STEPS:") if promising_results: print(f"1. Manual review of {len(promising_results)} high-relevance results") print(f"2. Follow specific URLs to extract detailed trial information") print(f"3. Contact research teams or institutions mentioned") else: print(f"1. Expand search to broader gastrointestinal-dermatology research") print(f"2. Search adjacent years (2017-2019) for related studies") print(f"3. Contact NIH program officers in relevant institutes (NIAMS, NIDDK)") print(f"4. Review conference proceedings and abstracts from 2018") print(f"5. Investigate investigator-initiated trials not in major registries") print(f"6. Consider that this specific research connection may not have been established in 2018")
Execution Output
Code Output: ========================================================================================== SIMPLIFIED APPROACH: BASIC NIH DATABASE TEXT SEARCHES H. PYLORI & DERMATOLOGICAL CONDITIONS CLINICAL TRIALS (2018) ========================================================================================== Using basic HTTP requests without BeautifulSoup dependency Focusing on text-based analysis of NIH database responses Executing simplified NIH database searches... 1.
